articles.author: Simon Bajkowski
articles.title: Man City given fixtures warning from Premier League restart plans - Manchester Evening News
articles.description: Manchester City are expected to return to training this week as all Premier League clubs are but the fixture schedule is yet to be worked out
articles.content:
Manchester City could be at an early disadvantage when football resumes as the Premier League makes plans for rearranged games in the schedule.

articles.author: Jake Polden
articles.title: Arsenal told they're in danger of making another huge Aaron Ramsey style mistake - Mirror Online
articles.description: Arsenal saw Aaron Ramsey leave on a free last summer after his contract expired in June 2019, and Jeremie Aliadiere fears Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang could do the same
articles.content:
Arsenal are in danger of seeing history repeat itself if they don't sell Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang in the summer transfer window.
That's according to Jeremie Aliadiere, who says he can't believe his former club have failed to learn from their previous mistak… [+1532 chars]

articles.author: Alex Dicken
articles.title: Wolves make transfer decision amid claims Liverpool deal is ‘agreed’ - Birmingham Live
articles.description: Wolverhampton Wanderers news - The club has confirmed John Ruddy's contract has been extended
articles.content:
Wolverhampton Wanderers have decided to extend John Ruddy's contract by a further year.
Experienced goalkeeper Ruddy, who has played back-up to number one Rui Patricio over the past two seasons, will now see his deal run out at the end of the 2020/21 campaig… [+1091 chars]

articles.author: John Cross
articles.title: BT Sport happy with Bundesliga figures despite being beaten by Midsomer Murders - Mirror Online
articles.description: EXCLUSIVE: German football returned with much fanfare with Borussia Dortmund vs Schalke on BT Sport 1, but was just the third biggest non-terrestrial show on Saturday
articles.content:
BT Sport insist they are happy with their viewing figures for the Bundesliga after live footballs big return.
Television figures showed that a peak of 652,000 - average of 500,000 - tuned in to Borussia Dortmunds win over Schalke on Saturday.
